snippet: Jose Antonio Vargas, probably the most high-profile leader of the immigrant rights movement, was released after being detained by the Border Patrol for most of Tuesday.
abstract: Jose Antonio Vargas, who has chronicled in minute detail the twists and turns of his life as a Filipino living illegally for years in the United States, is detained by Border Patrol in McAllen, Tex, and then released with a notice to appear before an immigration judge; detention of Vargas, probably the most high-profile leader of immigrant rights movement, poses awkward dilemma for Obama administration.

byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON and LAURA TILLMAN

lead_paragraph: Jose Antonio Vargas, probably the most high-profile leader of the immigrant rights movement, was released after being detained by the Border Patrol for most of Tuesday.

headline.seo: Jose Antonio Vargas, Immigrant Activist, Is Released by Border Patrol in Texas
headline.main: Immigration Advocate, Detained on Texas Border, Is Released in Visa Case
headline.print_headline: Immigration Advocate, Detained on Texas Border, Is Released in Visa Case
